identificationModule.briefTitle: Applying Artificial Intelligence to Identify Subphenotypes of Acute Kidney Injury in Mexican Patients With Severe COVID-19
identificationModule.officialTitle: Applying Artificial Intelligence to Identify Subphenotypes of Acute Kidney Injury in Mexican Patients With Severe COVID-19

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this observational study was to identify subphenotypes of acute kidney injury patients with COVID-19, and the investigators analyzed their impact on mortality. The study included demographic and clinical variables of the participants. The implementation of Machine Learning algorithms and Artificial Intelligence methods are used, and some specific implementations were designed for the analysis, where each group was characterized by traditional statistical methods.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Subphenotypes of acute kidney injury in patients
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of acute kidney injury subphenotypes in patients with COVID-19
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mortality of acute kidney injury patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences between mortality rates in acute kidney injury subphenotypes of patients with COVID-19
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Severity of acute kidney injury patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences between severity stages in acute kidney injury subphenotypes of patients with COVID-19
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Non-recovery in acute kidney injury patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences between non recovery rates in acute kidney injury subphenotypes of patients with COVID-19
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Renal replacement therapy requirement in acute kidney injury patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences between renal replacement therapy requirement rates in acute kidney injury subphenotypes of patients with COVID-19
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Length of stay of acute kidney injury patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences in-hospital length of stay in acute kidney injury subphenotypes of patients with COVID-19.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of one month

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients older than 15 years old, hospitalized, and with severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS-CoV-2) positive confirmation.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who did not have at least 1 creatinine measurement.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with acute kidney injury and COVID-19
